pd:dataInput.pd:label: project_dir
pd:dataInput.pd:description: directory with additional files/input to run pipeline --- other files in your github project

pd:dataInput.pd:label: input_files
pd:dataInput.pd:description: additional files/input to run pipeline --- other files in your github project

pd:dataInput.pd:label: kraken2_db_file
pd:dataInput.pd:description: TAR file that contains Kraken2 DB files

pd:parameter.pd:label: input
pd:parameter.pd:description: Path to comma-separated file containing information about the samples you would like to analyse. You will need to create a samplesheet with information about the samples you would like to analyse before running the pipeline. Use this parameter to specify its location. It has to be a comma-separated file with 3 columns, and a header row. See [usage docs](https://nf-co.re/viralrecon/docs/usage#introduction).

pd:parameter.pd:label: platform
pd:parameter.pd:description: NGS platform used to sequence the samples.

pd:parameter.pd:label: protocol
pd:parameter.pd:description: Specifies the type of protocol used for sequencing.

pd:parameter.pd:label: genome
pd:parameter.pd:description: Specifies the type of protocol used for sequencing.

pd:parameter.pd:label: outdir
pd:parameter.pd:description: The output directory where the results will be saved. You have to use absolute paths to storage on Cloud infrastructure.

pd:parameter.pd:label: email
pd:parameter.pd:description: Email address for completion summary. Set this parameter to your e-mail address to get a summary e-mail with details of the run sent to you when the workflow exits. If set in your user config file (~/.nextflow/config) then you don't need to specify this on the command line for every run.
